reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Des Archives for 5 nights in March, 2006, and look forward to staying there again the next time I visit Paris. The hotel is located at the quiet end of Rue Des Archives, within easy walking distance of both Arts et Metiers and Republique metro stations. Hotel De Ville, Notre Dame, Picasso Museum, Pompideau center are also within walking distance (15-20 minutes) of the hotel. The room I had was a single, well appointed furnishings and a decent sized en suite bathroom. The hotel staff was incredibley friendly in offering restaurant suggestions, providing directions to museums, and helping make a few local phone calls. The hotel also has free wi-fi access. There are a number of coffee shops, bakeries, and restaurants surrounding the hotel.
reviews.title: quiet hotel in the heart of Le Maraisi

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for one night (Saturday 25th) for my husband's birthday. Before arriving, I had emailed the hotel to mention the celebration and ask for an upgrade, if possible. When we arrived, I was told we had been given a "very nice room" on the fifth floor, which turned out to be the honeymoon suite. Naturally, I was thrilled and I thought this was great service, bearing in mind I had booked the room through Active Hotels for only €95 for the night.
